connector.description:
Send documents to MongoDB.

This Kamelet expects a JSON as body.

Properties you can as headers:

`db-upsert` / `ce-db-upsert` If the database should create the element if it does not exist. Boolean value.

camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.hosts.name: camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.hosts
camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.hosts.description: Comma separated list of MongoDB Host Addresses in host:port format.

camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.collection.name: camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.collection
camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.collection.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB collection to bind to this endpoint.

camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.database.name: camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.database
camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.database.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB database to target.

camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.writeConcern.name: camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.writeConcern
camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.writeConcern.description: Configure the level of acknowledgment requested from MongoDB for write operations, possible values are ACKNOWLEDGED, W1, W2, W3, UNACKNOWLEDGED, JOURNALED, MAJORITY.

camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.createCollect.name: camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.createCollection
camel.kamelet.mongodb-sink.createCollect.description: Create collection during initialisation if it doesn't exist.
